Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Davidp_10
Reviews.Content: I ordered a room via Agoda ,they are very good at it, however may be because of the rate I paid ,I got a room? Actually a cell . Something that has 2 meter width and less the 4 meters long. No place to put your suitcase and no place for anything else. The shower is 0.6x0.6 meter which means you can not move. Same size is the toilet. The room was pretty clean . I would recommend to anyone to check before hand what he is really getting. I was lucky to stay only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good services but small room”
Reviews.Author: JH6774
Reviews.Content: Everything is great about the hotel, just that the room is too small. It provided hair drier, shower cap, boiling kettle, toothpaste and toothbrush... There isn't really space to open luggage. Hotel was safe and comfortable for travelers from other countries. The hotel staff tried to be helpful and answer all of our questions. The subway was a short distance away which made it convenient for traveling to other destinations. It was possible to receive some tourist advice from the staff on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Oriental Lander Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JoyceB4
Reviews.Content: My husband and my son (16 years old) checked in to Oriental Lander Hotel in January 2012. We stayed there for 5 nights. We love the room so much although it is a bit small but I am happy that there have another smaller room for my son. The room and the bathroom are neat and clean. There is a place for us to put our luggages and bags too. I like the room as when we walk in turning to the left is our room and turning to the right is my son's room and bathroom is facing the room entrance. Another thing I am appreciate about the hotel is the staff there. They are helpful and very friendly. The location of the hotel is not too bad as it only takes about 10 minutes for us to reach MTR Station. It is very easy for us to get food nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Cubicle size room”
Reviews.Author: Greenhorn
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in (3 nights) is NOT for big size people but it is very clean. Though room is small my husband and I were able to move around in the room. As usual we always put away hotel's amenities to a corner and rearrange them so we have space for our own things. There is only space for one luggage on the floor. Bathroom is very very cramp. Sink is mini size and poorly designed that you cannot bend to wash your face or brush your teeth without knocking your head on the glass shelf above the sink. Nevertheless it is rather convenient to walk to the Prince Edward metro station. LAN line only but works well and with connectivity to Facebook. We have stayed in smaller rooms in Japan (business hotels) and had to place our luggage behind the room door. Tip: Dim sum restaurant called 一 点 心 behind the Police HQ corner of Playing Field Road. Small place and popular with locals. Be prepared to queue for an hour on weekends. Prices reasonable and food is fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on a boat”
Reviews.Author: geirsan
Reviews.Content: Clean with friendly but overenthusiastic and a little helpless staff, we chose this hotel because of price and availability. Rooms are very clean, but they're so small I had to leave my bags on the bed during the day to be able to use the room, and it was impossible to use the bathroom without spilling water on the floor, even when just washing the face. The ads said restaurant, but it was closed for some reason I couldn't confirm. This was a big problem, as there were no proper places to eat within a ten to fifteen minute walking distance. We were also promised city vies, but the only city I saw was the wall from the opposing building five meters from my window on the ninth floor. If I knew what I was paying for, this hotel is just fine, but lack of restaurant, no city view, and the impossible size of the rooms put me off recommending this hotel for anything more than a necessary sleep-in for a night. Beds and sheets were top notch, though.

Reviews.Title: “worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: DivyaPrakash_12
Reviews.Content: It was Worst Nightmare for me. This Property should not be on any Site.Bathroom size of only 2.2 feet * 6 feet. Room size only 6*7. Showed us Different Room but gave us Different one. Left after ONE Night Divya Prakash

Reviews.Title: “...Clean, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cieloism
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Opted to stay in this hotel primarily because of the price, room availability and convenience of being less than 10 minutes walk away from an MTR station. For the shoppers, it's approximately 15 to 20 minutes walk to the Ladies market. We got a double room, which came with ensuite toilet and bath with hot and cold water, medium bed, and free wired internet. There's not a lot of space to walk around, 3 steps from the door and its 's already the bed… that's it. If you are in a touristy mode, that's not an issue anyway since you'll be out most of the time. They don't have an in-house restaurant but there's a 7-11 in the MTR station so you can grab some midnight snacks, chips and some cup noodles, there's also a McDonalds nearby for your breakfast fix. Housekeeping was great, room was always spotless and in order every time we come home, which is just perfect since it was such a small room, one shoe or suitcase not pressed against the wall and it can easily get crowded. As mentioned in the previous reviews, it's true that there's only one elevator servicing all the floors… but lucky us we never had any issues with it being too slow or too full. Overall, despite the simplicity of the amenities, I will recommend this place because of the price and convenience, you get what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Moved out after 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Vuvie
Reviews.Content: The room is fully equipped but so terribly small. No space to put luggages at all. I need to jump to reach my bed which the furthest from the door. Everything is miniature. But complete. I don't know what to say.... It's clean and ok. Location is nothing to shout about. If I'd lived alone in that 2 person room, I think I might've survived. But 2 person in that tiny hole? Not possible. So I guess, to be comfortable here is to book a bigger room but actually just stay there with 1 person less.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are like pigeon holes”
Reviews.Author: PigeonholeinHK2011
Reviews.Content: My family & I just returned from Hong Kong on 8 Dec 2011. We stayed at this hotel for 6 nites. Kinna regretted in booking this hotel. Hotel website stated free boardband internet access but when we were there, there was no internet connection at all. The pictures of standard rooms posted at the hotel website are very deceiving. It looks nice & spacious. When we check-in, we were caught by surprised that the room is more like a pigeon hole. Only one can access to the toilet at a time. We didn't even have the space to put our luggages or walk within the room. We couldn't access to our room twice due to faulty of the access card. The television also faulty. Location of the hotel is even worst. Taxi driver doesn't know where it is even we showed him the hotel map. Apparently, we were told this hotel was previously an apartment. Hence, not many taxi drivers know the location. It is also not very near to the MTR. Hard to locate the hotel from the Prince Edward MTR. The hotel reception staff are also not very friendly & helpful. There is no facilities (eg. swimming pool, fitness, etc) in this hotel. In summary, staying at this hotel is not worth for money. I will not recommend anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aadhes
Reviews.Content: I visited this on the 26th of November, before I go I read the review of others in TA, we Wife and two teen aged Sons) travelled to the hotel by a taxi from the Airport it costed HK$ 235 (including 2 suitecases at the boot) Checkin was lightning speed no hustle, I book it through Booking.com it was smooth and fine.Triple room cost for 3days was HK$3694 (total room bill). Plus- 1.check in/out was fast 2. room was clean 3.easy access to MTR and Markets, 4. Some reasonable local restaurants are near by.4. Luggages can be left after checkout free of charge. Minus- 1.Room are very small (I was told by TA before I go and it was expected) 2. No Restaurents in the Hotel 3.hotel surroundings are ot condusive if you going for shopping and sight seeing no problem. 4.reception girls speak very little English, They can't explain anything because of lack of English knowledge. (They are kind and trying to help) Comments- It is a budget hotel If your partner or companion expects a plush and pampering this not a place. If you are concern with your budget this place is OK Roome are VERY SMALL BE AWARE. Room Tip Triple Room I think bit roomy than the others, we were at 8th Floor Road facing it was OK I may go again

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it !”
Reviews.Author: Ampatblas
Reviews.Content: A recent last minute four day business trip to Hong Kong found me scrambling for a hotel at the last minute. Expedia's vast list included the Oriental Lander Hotel Kowloon and being familiar with the Oriental Group in other Eastern cities I did not hesitate and assumed the quoted price was a mistake !! how wrong can a man get. The hotel shuttle bus from the airport seemed to get deeper and deeper into the rough end of Kowloon, finally pulling up at a diladidated entrance. My heart sank. On opening the entrace door, the smell of a very cheap antiseptic hit me, but Expedia had my money and there was no turning back ! My room on the 10th floor (No 1008) was smaller than my bathroom back in the UK. Everything seemed to be minatureised yet the fittings were of excellent taste ! ? No room for a clothes closet of course and the bed was on a ledge to the exact width of the room. To some people it was probably too hard as the mattress was the thickness of two blankets. It suited me though and was the only saving grace of the whole shuddering experience. No restaurant, no bar, just the all pervading antiseptic smell. This hotel is not recommended. . .

Reviews.Title: “Only if really necessary...”
Reviews.Author: Bentatravels
Reviews.Content: First, don't know for what reason but Taxis won't stop in front of the hotel door... So they'll drop you off on the opposite side of the road.. Second, hall is OK, looks very new.. But vital space is reduced to minimum. One only lift and that's a real minus.. But now to the room !!! Bathroom (so small not even on a Boeing 747) Aircon (so noisy I had to turn it off in order to sleep) Room (small small, I've been to HK for the last 10 yrs but this room was very small) So, all in all, the hotel is a 10 min walk from nearest MTR station. Very few taxis come by the hotel to pick up people. The room was clean but small. The aircon too noisy. The only plus was the staff which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Like living in a suitcase”
Reviews.Author: jackrh
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel can best be describes as an upscale youth hostel. The room is a matchbox. The bed is a 2/3 size single bed so it will fit into the space. A small desk next to the bed is useless since the room is so small they cannot put a chair there. Too far away to sit on the bed and write. There is only 1 outlet for the coffee pot available. They have no services in this hotel. You have to go out to eat. They do not even provide bottled water for the room! You have to go out and buy it. The bathroom is micro size. The shower is 2 feet by 2 feet. Once inside, there is no room to wash yourself. Then water floods the floor so you are standing in water to use it again. My luggage wound not fit in to room. I had 1 suitcase that I had to put on the bed to open it. Then close it and block the door to stand it on end. If there was a fire, it blocked opening the door. Location is so-so. MTR is a few blocks away, but nothing in the neighborhood, so you always have to take the MTR to another place. The room was clean enough. The bed linens were fresh and the room floor was ok. This is the smallest room I have ever seen. Maybe a single traveler could get buy on the cheap here, but I would not consider this place again. Also right across the street is a fire staton that is has sirens going off regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MChel24
Reviews.Content: Clean and tiny room... great value of money and is not far from the Kowloon City... Prince Edward Station is very near from this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, but good location”
Reviews.Author: scnuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights with hkd 500+ for each night. The room is tiny but it has everything that you need for a comfortable stay. The hotel staff are just average, doing their routine job. The hotel is within 10 min walk to Prince Edward mrt station which basically connect to all primary attractions you need to visit. Considering the hotel price, it is an average hotel, but no choice cos it is HK Maybe next time will try out some other hotels instead to explore more.

Reviews.Title: “Functional.”
Reviews.Author: berekum-ghana
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms. Wouldn't allow spouse to check in without original booker's passport (she had to go use a different hotel). In-room wired internet didn't work until switched room. In-hotel restaurant closed for a few months, apparently. Most beds twins (even in single). But, close to metro. You get what you pay for. Firm beds, hot water, pleasant enough staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Super Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Destinie W
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms accommodated 3-2-2 persons, stayed for 3 nights. Overall was satisfied. Reasonable price. The room is clean, super tiny, limited space in bathroom; provided basic necessaries except refrigerator. And 3 pax room was much more spacious than standard room, bathroom walk way as partition provided more privacy. Staffs were friendly. Free wifi only available in hotel lobby. Transportation: 5 mins walk to Prince Edward MTR station. Closed to Airport shuttle bus A21 drop off point, where in front of metropark hotel. Location: 10-15 min walk to Flower Street and ladies' market. Cafe and restaurants are available with walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but nice area and handy for transport”
Reviews.Author: AdAM0247
Reviews.Content: This must be the smallest room Ive been in but it was clean and it was in good repair. I liked the area, its quieter and away from the crowds but within 5 minutes of the MTR. Not a hotel to hang around in but to sleep and tour its good.

Reviews.Title: “good 'local' location, good service, super tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: abbieandjon
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights, location a bit out of town, but close to the subway, we had no problem getting to the main sights etc. recommend Ma's restaurant across the road for local chinese cheap food. room is very compact - we thought standard for Hong Kong until we checked into Anne Blacks YWCA for our last night (no rooms at OL) which had a massive room and much bigger bathroom. would recommend as a budget hotel - we didn't want to stay in the backpacker options as they weren't great in HK.

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay if you're going to be out the whole day”
Reviews.Author: shamaine2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decent and clean. I admit the rooms are really tiny but if you know that you're going to be out of the room the whole day, then it should be fine. Prince Edward MTR station is only 5 minutes away making it very convenient to move around. Went with a girlfriend and I have to say the location is safe.Nothing dodgy. Would seriously recommend for the price and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Smallish room with choked shower area”
Reviews.Author: sammie_lee_kw
Reviews.Content: It could be only for my room but every time we tried to bath, the bathing area was choked. Surprisingly, though the hotel opened in 2010, it is the smallest room I have stayed, with poor maintenance (couldn't open the door when we checked in - the manager has to tried with his cards and the choked bathing area), basically the 2 twin beds take up the whole hotel room. Service wise, staff are good. Cons: 1. Abt 10min from Jordan MTR 2. Nearby Coral de cafe - good for lunch 3. new - opened in 2010 4. took cab from airexpress kowloon station (nearby) 5. good hotel service 6. opposite hotel, try the new star restaurant for good and cheap dim sum Pros: 1. smallish room (smaller than dorsett seaview hotel) - twin beds take up whole of the hotel room 2. poor maintenance of facilities (choked bathing area, 1 lift and took long time..., unable open hotel room door, etc) 3. nothing much to see at jordan, next to hardware store

Reviews.Title: “Feels ripped off”
Reviews.Author: Fei W
Reviews.Content: I book a double room but was given a double made up of 2 single beds. Its hard to sleep with a gap in the middle. Asked to change cos i booked a standard double but was given the same type of room again when i return in the evening. Enquired about it and was told the staff got mixed up and there are no more "real double" available. Make sure u ask for what u want and get it ON THE SPOT! or else u will get 1001 excuses from them.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: HiteshWadher
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during december 2010. Its in Mongkok region of Hong Kong. The hotel is clean and rooms are ok. the hotel Staff is very cooperative. Hotel is very close to the shopping region like the night market, mobile mall and ladies market where you will get good quality clothing and accessories at low rates.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Gohanx666
Reviews.Content: i went to hongkong with my gf last june2010 for a vacation...we chose this hotel bcoz it was affordable for us...some of the reviews i've read before where true but it was not that bad...its true their rooms were a little bit small, coming from a guy who is only 5'3 in height. the bed was quite small also but it was fine for us bcoz we have a good night sleep everyday...plus the bathroom....way super small for any western guy to fit..if batista or any bulging muscled guy ever go to the bathroom, he will definitely tear it down... the location was not that great also bcoz its more of a "industrial type" kind of neighborhood.....luckily for us we never ever met with any inconvenience in our stay in the hotel like what others have in their stay..the lift was in a good condition and it never got broken...the place was very quite, suitable for a very good rest from a very tiring tour of the places in hongkong...we were very much equipped with the things we know the hotel don't have like mineral water and food.. With the rates they have, its way too perfect..all i can say the hotel was great and we will definitely stay there if we visit hongkong again.......p.s. the only problem we encounter is locating the hotel at first..hehehehehehe...

Reviews.Title: “Speechless”
Reviews.Author: Xiao_Ben
Reviews.Content: i book this hotel thru Agoda after reading some reviews on the website and another reason is the price (quite low for a hotel located in Kowloon). A big mistake to book thru Agoda (without reading the booking condition because there will be no refund if you cancel or amend the booking) and a big big mistake for chossing this hotel by reading the review written on Agoda website. if you book directly with the hotel the price is 20% lower than Agoda. i am sorry to say this but the review written by most traveller pertaning to the upper side of this hotel is not true. this hotel is quite isolated from from tourist places, no MTR nearby and you have to walk a few street to Jordan (where the famous night market are). the surrounding of this hotel are mostly hardware shop, furniture assembly shop and shop selling renovation materials like tile, marble and machining workshop. the room i had is a superior twin and is about 11 square meters (just good for 1 person and no more but anyway this is Hong Kong). the hotel don't provide bottle water in the room like most hotel so if you decide to stay here, preferably to buy some bottle water and some snack for supper as there is limited restaurant or store nearby. most of the traveller here are from mainland china where a whole group of ALL "female" team trying to make quick money with their 7 days tourist visa as the surrounding areas in Mongkok and Kowloon is a perfect love nest for them and demand is there...hahaha.. anyway, try to avoid this hotel so that you dont ruin your holiday mood. by adding a little more money, you can find a similar or more decent hotel along Nathan road.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel is possible”
Reviews.Author: BarbieRVC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights las weekend 10 July. The hotel is Tiny, the edge of the bed is inches from touching the wall. from basically every side. The shower space is exactly one 60cmx 60cm tile, its tiny its impossible to take a shower, if you manage the shower curtain is really no use..you end up with water everywhere and spills onto the carpet. The only plus I can say about this hotel is that it is only about 2 or 3 blocks away from MTR Prince Edward Station, but the area around is really awful, no nice anything plus nowhere to get a bite or food, so make sure you buy something before returning to the hotel. I would say that not even a good deal would be worth it as I think a hostel such as Y Loft may be a much much better option.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER small but otherwise clean”
Reviews.Author: pamkaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel room is SUPER small. The bed fits just right for Asian height. The shower area is only 1.5 marble tile big. No room to turn. However for Hong Kong standards the price is relatively cheap, but again no ample space. Fit for Asian guests ONLY. Free WIFI in the room also compared to other hotels in Hong Kong in which you have to pay 100HKD for a day's use. Also MTR is about 7 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small but that didnt matter”
Reviews.Author: Wildman_Aussie
Reviews.Content: Definitely no room to swing a cat but that wasnt a problem as pets arent allowed anyway We selected this hotel as we had child with us we took the triple room with double and single bed. Not many rooms in Hong Kong have this Very clean and modern and very comfortable. The shower is small but very powerful and hot We would love to take the mattress and pillows home with us. We slept very well as it was very quiet About 5 mins walk to Prince Edward Station and 10 mins to the local markets (didnt see any tourists there except for us). Later we went further down Nathan road and found the tourist market where we found the same stuff for 50% higher price Lots of small local restaurants with great food but you have absolutely no idea what to order so make sure there are other people eating so you can just ask for what they are having!! If you want to go down to the Star Ferry to watch the night light show catch the double decker bus number 1 or 2 from Nathan Road HK$4.40 (HK$2.20 concession) Free internet in room. Also room safe!

Reviews.Title: “Clean small room with good location”
Reviews.Author: tozenter
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights with my mother. The room was deluxe twin bed. Although the room and its bathroom were small, they're kept clean everyday. Staffs were good and the thing I like most about this hotel is its location. The nearest MTR station is Prince Edward to which you can walk within 10 minutes comfortably. There was a night when me and my family were out so late that the MTR closed and we decided to walk from Mong Kok area. And the distance wasn't that far. I would definitely stay there again if I want to get a place in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with Tiny Bathroom not worth of money.”
Reviews.Author: deslsan
Reviews.Content: When I reach the hotel room our jaws almost drop. Is really tiny and bath room door not able to close if u want sit on the toilet bowl. Hair dryer out of order. Room next to the lift, noisy early in morning when other guest are waiting for it. problem getting down the bed as I have to ask my hubby to get down the bed to let me out of it. Not able for any late check out. late check out will be charge half day rate. Will not go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joll32
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, but has very small room. For average european human are rooms too small, nice furnitera, lcd tv and good equipment, but window ussually to the wall or to the terrible yard. Location is close to nathan road and 5 minites walk to the metro station. Good price clean room and average location makes great chois for individual travelers. Staff is very helpfull, but do not expect same kind of pool or great views, gym or relax.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing to shout about...”
Reviews.Author: MeiLin C
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks ok... at least it's not shabby like those in Mirador Mansion or Chungking Mansion. Rooms are a lot smaller than I thought. We were unlucky to get the room at the corner when the space were cut off half by the door. The moment we open the door, we had to jump on the bed so that the other person can come in. Toilet is tiny, too. The shower place is practically 2x2 big. When you shower, the shower curtain tends to stick to your body. That's how small it is.Nevertheless, it's clean and bed & pillow are comfy as well. It also comes with the basic ameneties. As to get there, it's not as near as it stated from the Prince Edward MTR. You'll have to cross 2 or 3 streets to get there which takes about 10mins. It's not exactly near when you are lugging a big luggage or just came back from a whole day sightseeing and shopping. Lastly, a more friendly staff would be a plus. They were not really that accomodating and helpful. Probably that's how HK ppl are...I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MissShaSha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly clean and the location isn't bad but a lot of the staff are really rude. They were rude to me and rude to my friend who is a local here. When I called the front desk to ask for help finding an adapter so I could use my computer and other things that require electricity the staff member that answered the phone was really rude, hung up on me and never brought the adapter. I had to call back later and talk to someone else to get one. For the last two days of my stay the water in the shower and sink disappeared. There would be a few lucky moments where if I was fast I could get a shower, but I had to be fast or the water would turn off. The staff apologized but offered no explanation or solution to the problem. The shower was a real problem, it just had a flimsy curtain and tiny lip on the floor to keep all the water in. It never does keep the water in though and the floor is always completely flooded. My shower also had a problem where the cord for the shower head had several leaks so the water pressure was minimal and a lot of water was being lost that way. It seemed really wasteful to me. For the price of a room I would not stay here again, I'm sure I could find something better for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: minghui79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriental Lander Hotel for 3 nights during our recent HK vacation. Located about 5 minutes by foot from the Prince Edward MTR Station, the hotel was tricky to find at first. However, after familiarise ourselves with the local neighbourhood, it was a breeze for the rest of our stay. The hotel is tucked into the quiet Tong Mei Street opposite the Mongkok Fire Station. The immediate neighbourhood was quiet at night which gave us a peaceful 3 nights stay. Checking in at the hotel at 2pm, the process was fuss free. I like that they had already written down our names in our breakfast coupons prior to our arrival. As expected with most HK hotels, our twin bedroom was very small, yet good enough for 2 of us. The toilet was tiny but it was very clean and well stocked with toiletries. An in-room safe was provided with a functional plasma cable TV. Our beds were very comfortable. The minor drawback were that there was no mini fridge and there were no complimentary drinking water available. The complimentary breakfast was always a plus but it was a mixed affair. There was one morning when we arrived at the cafe at 9am only to find the lights off even though it was clearly stated that the breakfast hours would be until 10.30am. This aside, we liked our stay with the Oriental Lander. The service at the hotel was never outstanding in my opinion. But they were not rude either. They were willing to listen to our queries but it would be good if they were more welcoming.

HotelInfo.Name: Oriental Lander Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.206 Tongmi Road, Mong Kok, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
